channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for AL
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for AL

item.title: Report X-2025061269
item.description:
Report X-2025061269

Identified by scraper @ 2025-06-22T01:13:25+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-06-16
  • City: BESSEMER
  • State: AL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Unmarked fiberboard box containing a 5gal plastic drum of corrosive liquid degreaser. Exterior box has no diamonds, orientation arrows, or OP-900. Package was initially flagged for the corroded external box while unloading a trailer. Hazmat was confirmed via litmus paper testing, and exact material was identified by product label on the side of the drum. The head of the drum appears to have been fitted incorrectly, as there is a gap on one side, allowing contents to spill out. External box appears to have absorbed the majority of the spill but was ruined in the process. No evidence of further spillage was observed.

item.title: Report E-2025060266
item.description:
Report E-2025060266

Identified by scraper @ 2025-06-22T01:13:25+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-06-05
  • City: BIRMINGHAM
  • State: AL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On June 5, 2025, one (1) 55-gallon drum of UN3082 tipped over and damaged the cap. Due to the damage, the drum released approximately five (5) gallons of product to the trailer floor. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Marion Environmental (ME) to remediate the impacted site. The crew placed the damaged drum in one (1) 85-gallon overpack. Absorbent pads were utilized to collect the released material and were containerized in one (1) 55-gallon drum for disposal.

item.title: Report E-2025060298
item.description:
Report E-2025060298

Identified by scraper @ 2025-06-22T01:13:25+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-05-19
  • City: THEODORE
  • State: AL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO ENTERPRISE SERVICES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: At 11:14 ET, XPO-NML reported a 1-quart release of Vega Built Detergent which released from one 5-gallon poly pail. Terminal personnel cleaned up and containerized the spilled product before contacting the call center, an SDS has not been located. A Waste ID will be generated once an SDS is located, the emergency contact will be notified of the release. The waste was placed into 1-35gal DF and staged in OS&D.
